DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Reported Event Term Sponsor Defined Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Terminology assigned by the sponsor to the codelist associated with the biospecimen event observation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Reported Event Term
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information._The collected name for an event observation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information.

Concepts.definition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information.

Property.preferredDefinition: The literal identifier assigned to an event.

Concepts.definition: The collected name for an event observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Reported Event Term Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The collected name for an event observation._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]._Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.: A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.
A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.: Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.: The act or business of transporting goods.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The act or business of transporting goods.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of shipping something from one facility to another, usually to a customer or end user, or to a more specialized facility.

Concepts.definition: The process of shipping something from one facility to another, usually to a customer or end user, or to a more specialized facility.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a sample should be returned to its biobank.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a sample should be returned to its biobank.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The collected name for an event observation.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
